citation.article-title: Rhodobaca bogoriensis gen. nov. and sp. nov., an alkaliphilic purple nonsulfur bacterium from African Rift Valley soda lakes.

p.s: Species description of Rhodobaca bogoriensis sp. nov.

Rhodobaca bogoriensis (bo.gor.i.en'sis. L. adj. bogoriensis pertaining to Lake Bogoria, a soda lake in Kenya, Africa; Rhodobaca bogoriensis a red (rose) berry from Lake Bogoria Anoxygenic phototrophic purple nonsulfur bacterium)
Cells are gram-negative motile cocci to short rods measuring 0.8–1 μm × 0.8–1.5 μm.
Color of anaerobically grown cells is yellow to yellowish-brown.
In vivo absorption maxima of phototrophic cells, 871 nm.
Cells contain bacteriochlorophyll a and carotenoids of the spheroidene pathway; demethylspheroidenone is the major carotenoid in anoxic/light-grown cells.
Intracytoplasmic membranes of the vesicular type.
Light-harvesting (LH) I pigmentprotein complex present but an LH II system absent.
Grows photoheterotrophically and chemotrophically (oxic/darkness).
Carbon sources supporting excellent phototrophic growth include succinate, malate, pyruvate, fumarate, acetate, mannitol, butyrate, valerate, heptanoate, xylose, glucose, fructose, and sucrose.
Nitrogen sources utilized are ammonia, aspartate, glutamate, asparagine, glutamine, and casamino acids.
Biotin and thiamine are required growth factors; in defined medium vitamin B12 is not required but is growth stimulatory.
Best growth achieved in media containing 0.05–0.1% yeast extract.
Alkaliphilic; optimum growth occurs at pH 9 (pH range 7.5–10) in media containing 1–3% NaCl (however NaCl not required for growth).
Optimal growth temperature, 39 °C.
No evidence for autotrophic growth with H2+CO2 or H2S+CO2, and nitrogen fixation not detected.
The G+C content of the DNA is 58.8 mol%.
Phylogeny, a member of the α-Proteobacteria with its closest relatives residing in the Rhodobacter/Rhodovulum clade.
The type strain is LBB1T, isolated from water/sediment samples from Lake Bogoria, Kenyan district of African Rift Valley.
Deposited in the American Type Culture Collection as ATCC 700920.
Genbank accession number of 16S rRNA gene sequence, AF248638.
